The code that has been moved from package.py to the ServiceDriver - package.py was heapSize*1.2. Java is using *2

Computing the headroom in the daemon.
Didn't understand this part (will be 0 very often)

 return Math.max(0, minHeadRoom - headRoom);

There's normally a 6+GB headroom between (xmx + cache) and container-size - to account for off heap allocations.

This headroom was to carve out a part of the heap for llap data structures, and the cache. Think the simples would be to take the configured value (5%) and use that with JVM.maxAvailable.

The latest patch switches to LLAP considering purely xmx headroom, assuming the caller takes care of non-xmx headroom that is needed due to JVM overhead/etc causing YARN kills. That headroom is configurable as either size or percentage, 5% by default. Tested on a cluster, works as expected.
